Non recommandé
8.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2014
Updated Review: September 2015.

After more than a year I still cannot reccommend the game.

The major complaints I had last june still persist.
I have a brand new, high end computer, and the gameplay still doesn't seem to get fluid.
The camera seems to be slow to react, and specially when moving the camera quickly it just doesn't feel right. If you're used to playing on lower (~30) framerates you probably don't notice it, but for me it was very noticable.

Another major issue is the jumping, you seem to be falling down really fast after reaching the highest point in your jump, because the game features quite a few of fairly harsh jumps this can be really annoying.

The fact that I can't save when I want can be a valid design choice, but not being able to re-save again after a checkpoint can be really frustrating. If you fail a section multiple times and need to keep grabbing the same cubes it just gets frustrating. I don't understand why we can't save again after say a cooldown period of ~5 seconds.

==============

Original Review: June 2014
Do I recommend this game?
At the moment no, but if the developers fix some things I think I will:

1) perfomance issues.
without vsync I had some horrible screentear.
with vsync I had some horrible fps

2) Save points
Some of the save points are often a pain. They can be really unforgiving and walking past them again doesn't save again. This can lead to doing things over and over again.

3) Lack of personal saves
I think this is a design choice but I'd liked to have a quicksave option before trying some crazy moves. Combine this with the sometimes terrible save points and it can be really frustrating to play sometimes.


Some personal problems I had:
- the music got on my nerves quite a bit
- slow pacing, specially the first 2 worlds are very easy.

The game has some good things too though:
- the mechanics from the third and fourth cubes cube are really fun.
- the visual style is really cool and works pretty well.
- the gameplay itself is done well, the mechanics work well.
- it feels like minecraft combined with portal!
 
🍪 Anna
2

Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2015
Qbeh-1 è un gioco puzzle a cubetti, facile fino ai primi 4 mondi, poi diventa molto difficile.

L'atmosfera, il paesaggio di questo gioco sono fantastici, ♥♥♥ una grafica impeccabile e dettagli spettacolari.

Le musiche sono molto tranquille e si sposano perfettamente ♥♥♥ il paesaggio, infatti, ogni livello avrà la sua musica che ci sta veramente tanto ♥♥♥ esso.

Da comprare assolutamente! Fidati, non è difficile, puoi permetterti di distrarti guardando l'atmosfera intorno a te che come ho già detto non è fantastica, è sublime.

Évaluation publiée le 24 mars 2016
Симпатичная медитативная игра, головоломка от первого лица. Открытые просторы, деревья, водопады создают ощущение свежего воздуха. А головоломочная часть заставляет повориться котелок. Элементы с каменными божествами дают впечатление о цивилизациях племен индейцев, а кубические строения наоборот вовлекают в технологическую футуристичность.

0
Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2015
Minecraft and portal had a baby and called it Qbeh. It was a simple kid, not much to look at, but not ugly either. He didn't do much except make puzzles, but when he did, he did them pretty well.
With plenty of lateral and three-dimensional thinking, Qbeh succeeds where similar indie projects fail. The rules of the world are simple and clear, but with enough wiggle room to allow you to circumnavigate some puzzles, or find new (and over-complicated) routes.
A surprisingly good injection of puzzling![6.0]
 
Arachin

びっくりした。あぁ四角い形でどこぞのなんちゃらクラフトのパクリかなにかか・・・と思って買わなかったが、パズルパックで買ってやってみたら面白くて驚愕。どうすればいいのかという思考とうまく行けた時の達成感もあり、雰囲気も言葉には表せない良さがある。
パズル系ゲームが好きな人、FPSとかやって疲れた人に是非オススメしたい。

Recommandé
16.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2017
Review based on World 1.

I am definitely enjoying this game. At 2.1 hrs, I just beat the first world, but I am only using the keyboard, which I do not recommend. It works well enough. But it is not the most efficient way to control the game, in my opinion.

This is so far, a pleasantly challenging(I am NOT a puzzle pro) puzzle game in a relaxing setting wtih an appropriately relaxing soundtrack. This is not the hardest game you will ever play, but it does require thought. I bought it on sale, as that is the only way I buy games these days. It has pretty much already earned what I paid for it.

A great, relaxing, somewhat challenging game.
 
cckandt

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
83.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 juillet 2016
This game has really good soundtracks relaxing. Also no clock to beat. The levels are incredibly made and the graphics are beautiful so the player can see awesome things from heights and etc.. Addicting game. It's good to teach players new skills with low difficulty and then increasing it with more rewards (beautiful views, etc.). It has an interesting game concept and a really good atmosphere. Also the level editor is also fun if the player gets a bit bored and want to make his/her levels and create a beautiful map teaching a new mechanic to the game and after that publishing it.
Try first the demo and then choose if you want to buy it or not. I recommend buying the game.
The developers are also really positive and friendly so no worries if you need something :)
 
blueshark
177 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2015
Если честно , то при покупке Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube, я очень долго размышлял о том понравится ли мне эта игра или нет. Но после первого часа игры все сомнения исчезли и я понял что это действительно очень стоящий проект. В Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube вы оказываетесь в мире кубов. Под приятную релаксовую музыку вы занимаетесь поиском решения разнообразных головоломок . По ходу игры вы будете находить и использовать разноцветные кубы , которые и станут вашими верными друзьями на пути к достижению цели. В игре есть шесть миров которые изображены в виде больших белых кубов . И в каждом таком мире присутствует по шесть уровней. Изначально нам доступен всего один мир. Но после прохождения первого мира начнут постепенно открываться и остальные миры. Сложность в игре меняется постепенно , как и размеры уровней. Также после каждого пройденного мира (6 уровней) в игру будут вводить по одному новому цветному кубу, у каждого из которых свои особенности. Например один куб может открывать двери , а другой давать вам возможность высокого или дальнего прыжка. Смотря какого цвета куб. Также в игре присутствует поиск секретов в виде желтых треугольников , которые кстати не всегда просто обнаружить. В целом атмосфеса в Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube очень приятная и дарит игроку многие часы отличного геймплея .
 
SKYFROST
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2018
我不喜歡這個解謎遊戲
從一開始就常常在一格的大小內操作，由於作者算的很精密，所以你只要少一個方塊就是到不了
然後常常沒注意就落下方塊，啊場景是在天空啊，所以落下的結果就是重來啊啊啊啊啊~~~
重來1,2個步驟是應該
重來10,20步驟是極限
但是我重來一次要弄2分鐘(上百個操作)
然後一個失誤又要2分鐘
操作時間遠大於解謎時間
手殘的我這種遊戲玩不下去~

415 produits enregistrés

Non recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2018
비주얼이 예쁜 퍼즐세상에 퐁당 빠진 느낌은 좋지만, 생각보다는 단조로운 편입니다.

퍼즐게임들이 이제는 워낙 많이들 나오다보니. 스토리/더 예쁜 그래픽/더 짜릿한 퍼즐을 제공하는 게임들과 비교하여 상대적으로 덜 튀는 편이라고 생각합니다.

에디터도 지원해 유저가 직접 레벨디자인을 해서 공유도 할 수 있긴 한데.. 애초에 게임플레이 자체에 매력을 느끼지 않으니, 이 또한 새로운 즐거움을 주지 못하는 것 같습니다.

한 번 쯤 쓱 플레이해보기에는 나쁘지 않지만, 막 찾아서 다시하고 싶을 정도는 아닌 것 같다는게 개인적인 느낌입니다.
 
laazycat
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2015
Sehr sehr geiles Puzzel-Platforming Game. Tolle Atmosphere, angenehmer beruhigender Soundtrack.
Hoher Wiederspielwert, da die Tokens wirklich schwer zu finden sind.
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad der Level ist wirklich gut ausbalanciert.
Ausreichend Checkpoints sind vorhanden.
Hab für einen Durchgang (30 Level) 10 Stunden benötigt und nichtmal alle Tokens gefunden.

Empfehlenswert!

0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
43.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2015
写在前面的最终评价：操作感和游戏难度简直糟糕得令人发指，不好意思我要改成差评。
------------------------------------------------------------------

【鉴于大家对这款游戏写的评测都差不多，外星人决定把原测评删了，写个三角攻略，因为游戏比较小众网上攻略实在难找，更不要说每一关都在那么中二的地方了......】

1-1我用的是爬树法，就是进去之后第一眼看到的那棵树，有个角度对着树一直走会被扔到天上去的【虽然可能摔死，虽然从漏洞房间那里也能跳过去，但跳过去之后在房间里不好爬到窗户高度，需要很多块，于是懒人的我决定还是爬树】，控制好落点可以掉到房顶上，在房顶上仔细观察，有一条悬空道路延伸向远方，从那里跳下去，再顺着浮空砖块跳，就会到达一个隐藏房间，三角在房间里，房间另一边出口接近关底，无需原路返回，也不需要方块垫脚。

1-2进入不久在一个拿红方的地方，有一根歪倒的图腾柱，柱子旁两个窄口从左边的一个跳出去爬上外墙上面的凸出砖，可以到隐藏房间，三角在里面。

1-3可以看到出口的平台上，左手边墙壁有一堆好像无规则的砖块，把红块放在中间做成平台台阶，从悬空处斜着跳到一阶砖上，然后依次爬上二阶三阶，之后进入上层房间，房间中央有一堆砖，踩着红块爬到顶可以看到三角。

1-4这关三角算是最好拿的一个，到手两个红块后，爬墙上去，在带树浮空块前边的地方，注意左下角位置有一条窄窄的楼梯，三角就在起跳平台下面。

1-5记录点旁边有很多柱子那条走廊，对着红块的方向有一个窗户，对面也有一个窗户，跳窗过去是三角。

1-6三角在最后的楼里面，有一个房间天花板破了洞，地面为5*7，中间一圈紫色的砖围着三丛花，一侧墙靠上有两块可以安放红块的黄砖，搭梯子爬上屋顶【注意爬上屋顶大约需要15红块，用完记得尽可能回收，至少拿回8-9块，不然之后的路过不去】，沿着屋顶走到秘密房间，进去左边有一条路，下面是3格宽地面还带漏的房间，跳下去继续走，【总算是】找到三角。
------------------------------------------------------------------

2-1最后两个机关房间内有一根粗柱，柱子右边跳过一块砖会发现小门，进去走到底有三角。

2-2接近终点的通道，左右两边都是窄门那个，其中有一条特别长，进去七拐八拐走到最里面发现三角。

2-3背对出口伸出来的两条柱，左边一条再往左一格的位置跳下去，站在凸出的砖上往右移动一格，转身可以看见三角，拿了三角后跳上最高的魔方，启动电梯到楼顶，完后找到出口方向跳下来穿关。

2-4此关有一个地方可以一次性拿到两个蓝块，三角就在蓝块的墙后边，通过来路那边的墙裂缝跳上图腾柱，柱子挨着的墙外边有一圈一格的落脚点，那里可以通放三角的台，拿了三角后从另一边落脚点回去。

2-5三角在一个单独的好像碉堡的房子里，碉堡上边有一个P形状的砖石旗子，很好找，要过去的话手上需要有三块蓝方，一块搭桥，一块移开路上停放的魔方，一块放在碉堡大门的下边，从高处往下跳过三格距离，进里面往上爬（记得回收蓝方），拿到三角后从一侧小平台跳下。此关有爱心方块，位置在四个移动魔方的大厅里，角落有一个围起来的小房间。此关难点在两个巨大移动方块的地方，要带着蓝方跳到对面去，不能把蓝方丢在房里，否则后边过不去。

2-6最终房间，就是墙上有很多黄块，天花板可以看见特殊紫块的房间，注意墙面有一处不起眼的三格高缺口，需要用红块搭一条横跨房间的走道跳上去，三角在外边的窗台上，很近。此关有魔法人方块，位置在最后的高楼里，有两块黄砖的无顶房间，在那里红方垫脚可以爬到高台上，也可以爬到外墙外边，顺外墙往左手边走，拐弯地方有窄通道，魔法人方块在里面，出口比较隐蔽，连接刚进高楼的那段通道。紫方旁边房里有两个蓝方记得拿。
------------------------------------------------------------------

3-1三角在第二记录点旁边，有墙豁口，出去走外墙上的凸出砖（这条路非常阴险，还好只用走一次），最后可以跳到枯树旁的房间，之前可以在远处看到这个三角。

3-2拿到反重力紫块后的记录点，就是第一次出现黄块靠天花板那里，用红块搭桥往来路的屋顶方向延伸，端点放紫块，确保覆盖住墙后边的区域，踩着房顶走过去，爬过一个不高的墙，三角就在墙下面。

3-3三角在连续两道带锁门里面，就是狭长，中间有漏地板，漏地板正上方是黄块那里，必须拿到紫块和至少一个蓝块后才能去，用第一道门正对面放着的蓝块开第二道门。

3-4三角的位置在两块黄块，中间是一个需要在外墙启动魔方，之后的门外边的高台上，出门走远点可以回头看见，但想从那里跳上去是不可能的，要继续往下走，拐弯后图腾柱右上方有一个墙洞，记住洞的位置，从内部爬上那个洞贴着墙过去，那个地方不是很好跳，怕摔下来的话可以将紫块放在楼里面罩住靠近三角的区域。

3-5拿这关的三角有两个要点，在天花板需要两个蓝方的大厅里，打开锁住的门，过去之后记得只拿蓝方！拐弯后竖放的两个红方千万不要动！！完后回收钥匙两只蓝方，因为块不够摆梯子，回到回字型黄块的天井房间，用尽手上的块，把紫方放在距离左边强一格，紧挨平台，高出平台一格或者这个坐标附近的地方，确保反重力范围覆盖四格宽的裂缝，墙边的两个红方，以及裂缝上面的平台边缘，这样才能跳上去拿三角，下来以后即可以回收红方，顺带激活记录点，这时候再用两蓝方开门前进。

3-6三角在终点大门背面，左侧通道走到头有门。这关终点钥匙放置位置比较坑，在外侧通道红方搭梯子跳上去，走到正对终点大门的高平台上，左手边。
------------------------------------------------------------------

4-1第一个向上吹的风扇那里，从墙的另一边豁口出去顺着路走，就可以看到三角在一个平台下面。有个地方激活魔方用的蓝方，过去以后记得从外墙绕过去拿，下面还要开门用。

4-2三角在使用移动魔方挡风扇那个房间后面，因为蓝方只有一个，所有要搭好桥，等魔方移动到尽头拿走蓝方，趁魔方移动回来迅速过去，在用蓝方激活锁住的门，放钥匙位置在天花板上，这条路上都是坏门，一旦走过去别想回来。注意靠墙放置的坏风扇边上有小门，里面有记录点。

4-3拿最开始四个红方的房间，先只拿靠门一边的一个红方，完后踩着台子跳到窗台外边，一路跳跳跳到记录点背后拿三角，之后还要原路跳跳跳回来，坑。

4-4三角在关底电扇房的顶上，把一个紫方放在最后一块黄块上，从外边跳上。

4-5三角在蓝方的屋顶上，先不要动蓝方，踩着它跳到外面，完后一路小心绕着外墙往上登，拿到三角后从另一边下去，就是最高的小平台那里，那里有个洞是蓝方房间的天花板洞。

4-6拿这关的方块首先要在多门多风扇那个大厅，激活中央风扇，完后把紫块往右下图腾方向放，放好以后跳回去拿启动风扇的蓝方，踩着两个图腾的头顶上最上面的门，屋子里的蓝方放在右手边的小高台上，放错了会被吹下去，接着拿好节省下来的蓝方上风扇，注意这个风扇口很小，如果之前忘了省蓝方下来，就得重新来了，用这个蓝方打开那里的门，三角在里面，位置在三个风扇的机关屋，正确的那个机关上方。
------------------------------------------------------------------

5-1三角在终点门正下方，要拿的话得先到终点门前，看地上的砖缝，里面有一个机关，剩下来的那个方块就是用在那里的，启动之后要怎么干我就不知道了，因为本人用的是危险的笨办法，即从下面的窗户进去，拿到后再从下面的窗户出去继续悬空往上爬……

5-2三角在那个独立的建筑，就是门口一块黄砖两棵悬浮树，水里泡着蓝块房间的阳台上，需要先过去，完后在门口放块，踩着绿方上房顶，上去以后往右前方走，跳下去就能看到三角了，窗户一边有记录点翅膀当着从里面跳不过去必须上房顶……

5-3三层楼高的那个大厅里，三角在漏屋顶那边，墙上有个洞，要拿首先得跳到那边的门前，完后用块水平往过搭连接，再放一个绿快跳上去，沿着墙有一格不明显的地方可以走，走到墙洞出去就看见三角了。
------------------------------------------------------------------

本攻略到此夭折，因为我在5-3虽然拿到了三角，但到最后大门前死活跳不过去，试了几十次就差一格或者半格的距离，完后就掉进了虚空，弄得外星人我身心疲惫，等我先喝瓶82年的百事败败火。
作者我恨你！
 
Mwxr
302 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2015
1.Booring. 2. Easy. 3.WHITE!
1.The sence (place cube jump on it - go on) isnt fun after 2-3 lvls. New cube (blue) didnt help. Grabity was ok, but it just gives a higher jump.
2. U dont have to think. Just auto: see the place where u can place a cube - place it, jump on it, step forward - take the cube back. Maybe at world 5 it'll be more difficult, but i dont want to spend 5 hours with punkt.3 and 1 to make some activeness to brain. I can just open Portal and play some custom maps.
3. Everysthing WHITE. made the half brightness on screen, still somethimes painfully to watch outside the corridors (the background on some lvls are totaly white. And the end-start loading is white screen. With the lvl name on BRIGHT WHITe. Between the levels its about 20 sec of empty screen, u can guess what colour it is.

So have no idea who liked it and why. Probably with oculus its pretty fun, but with no - awfull.

Évaluation publiée le 23 février 2018
Что я могу сказать про эту игру, она прекрасная, это трехмерная головоломка с кубиками, сначала ты ищешь эти кубики на уровне, а потом используешь чтобы пройти уровень. В общем здорово, плюс графическое исполнение на высоком уровне, приятная музыка и страх, потому что уровни находятся высоко в небе

Non recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2015
Офигенная логическая игрушка! приятная графика. Неплохой гемплей. Qbeh похожа на игру Q.U.B.E. только всё происходит на небесах. С каждым новым уровнем тесты становятся сложнее и интересней. Также в игре присуствуют посхалки и золотые пирамидки они находятся в сложных местах. Когда нашол все пирамидки в 5 мирах то окрывается секретный 6 мир с более усложнёнными уровнями.

1
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
24.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2014
Great puzzle game, and not too hard, not too easy. The scenery is beautiful and the soundtrack completes the atmosphere of the game. The difficulty and even size of each level increase gradually as the player progresses through the levels and worlds.

The levels are occasionally tricky to navigate, plus they're airborne, so falling off is definitely not recommended, and to add to the challenge there are no maps or compasses, though they are not labyrinths, outright. There are very rarely alternate paths whose dead ends you cannot see from the beginning, so the correct way forward isn't hard to find, or create. You only have to take detours to find hidden rooms and crevices containing items you may need to continue.

I wish the game was longer. Absolutely recommended.
 
Tzitzimime
3
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2016
First-person puzzle game.

You have to get from the beginning to the end of the level using the different features of several different types of cubes. Unlike DOOM (1993), in which you had to fight enemies while activating switches and getting colored keys to open like-colored doors to access more of the level until you reached the end of the not-really-3D levels, Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube levels exist in a fully-3D world in which you must use cubes to construct platforms to reach other areas, approach bird-like structures which unfurl their "wings" (I'm unsure about the function of these bird-like or spaceship-on-the-ground-like structures at this point), and, eventually find your way to the shining white exit region.

Instead of baddies, your primary enemy (other than the puzzles themselves) in this game is gravity; the levels (at least in the first world, the last level of which I'm close to finishing) are constructed of stone cubes and other structures suspended in a void of some kind. The lighting and shadows are really beautiful, but falling through a gap or off a ledge will restart the level or load the last save point.

I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys first-person games, and especially to those who enjoy solving puzzles.
 
Potentiality12

Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2018
Trick Question pretty much summed it up.

The only challenge in this game is not falling off. You can be 80% of the way through a puzzle and then have to do it all again.

The level selection menu is a mess too, forcing you to navigate around 3D objects and essentially remember where you were up to. Game developers should know by now that these kinds of interfaces are not useful or fun.

A few more save points per level would have saved this mediochre game from the garbage bin.

Vidéo YouTube™: MOB Review: Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube 
Vues : 306
Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube is a puzzle cube game with heavy atmosphere and a therapeutic touch, that will relax your mind and sooth your woes away.

It is good to know when an issue arises that the developers are taking care of them. The game itself has an amazing atmosphere created by great music and visuals that give a deep personal feel and therapeutic touch to the game. The puzzles in the game are easy to grasp and the game the game runs smooth. Thanks for your time and viewership, be sure to share how you feel, be sure to thumbs up the video, share or dislike and tell us why. For more reviews be sure to check out the channel at https://www.youtube.com/user/SocioPyscho

0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2015
Sleepwalking pace, lousy controls and... seriously. Level title screens, that are solid white save the title, that take upwards of twenty seconds to clear? If you're hiding loading progress, don't. I'd rather the illusion that something is going on behind the scenes, rather than the suspicion that the designer has their thumb up their ass.

A checkpoint-based save system, short jumps, and absurdly slow movement through water --contact with which locks you out of an achievement-- punishes exploration and experimentation, requiring the player to backtrack every time they miss a step. This feels like something that would have been impressive fifteen or twenty years ago, but is merely an unpolished tech demo today.
 
Bieeanshee
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2017
我曾是个MC玩家，但玩了几十个小时就放弃了。
我发现我在MC里只干一件事：在日出时发呆，在日落时发呆，在下雨时发呆，在打雷时发呆，在花了好久造的房子里继续发呆，在跑了大半个世界找到的小狗旁边仍然发呆。
我不知道为什么，直到碰到了这款游戏。
我明白了，小时候坐在田埂上看天看地看乡村，正是这种宁静的氛围令我陶醉不已。
这是一款无与伦比的氛围之作。
同时也是一款优秀的解谜作品。
游戏的氛围不必多说，满分。
解谜部分，前几关虽然稍显简单，但很好的让玩家熟悉了操作，同时又对解谜思路有了初步的了解。
后面的关卡保持了一贯的氛围，并将谜题和建筑有机的结合起来。建筑就是谜题，谜题也是建筑。天马行空的随意组搭可以感受到制作者的奇思妙想。
休闲玩家特别推荐👍
缺点：游戏过程有点晕，因人而异。
部分关卡完全看不见，有恶意提高难度的可能

Я бы рекомендовал эту игру от стресса, её можно применять в лечебных целях) Обалденные локации и медитативный саундтрек приводят в положительное умонастроение! Прекрасная игра что бы отдохнуть
Красивая музыка и пейзажи неба, создают умиротворяющую атмосферу. Если не напрягаться каждый раз когда ты в бесконечном полёте, а исключительно созерцать бренность бытия, то игра становится поставщиком спокойствия)

Lunaria
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
35.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 avril 2020
This game is one of the best puzzle games I have ever played. It is on par with other great puzzle games such as Portal 2 and The Talos Principle. What the developers have accomplished here in terms of level-design and gameplay is phenomenal. The puzzles are masterfully designed, you start simple, but gradually things become more complex, and the player must think ahead, it is the perfect level of challenge. The soundtrack, is easily the best part of the game, and it really makes the levels even more of a blast to play through. The minimalist style and lack of any story, make this game even better, as the most common issue that I have with puzzle games is that the stories can be weak. In Qbeh-1, the visuals ARE the story. The overall design of the game is fantastic, and with hundreds of community made levels to explore, this is a puzzle game you shouldn't miss. I can't recommend it enough.
 
Internet Millionaire

ΔÐß²
73 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2019
-- REQUISITOS PARA RODAR

(X) Qualquer PC (dps de 2010)
( ) Um PC Fraco, 2GB, sem placa de video (30 fps)
( ) Um PC Mediano, 4GB, com placa de video fraca ou integrada (60 fps)
( ) Um PC Forte, 8GB, com placa de video boa
( ) Um PC Muito forte 16GB, placa de video ATUAL

-- BUGS E FALHAS

( ) Brasil
( ) Bug pra todo lado
( ) Muita falha mas dá pra jogar de boa
( ) Bugs que são legais e não atrapalham
(X) Quase sem falhas
( ) Perfeito

-- HISTÓRIA

(X) eh.. então, Não. (Mas é um puzzle então a gente releva)
( ) tem história só pra não dizer que não tem (ruim)
( ) Dá pra gostar da história (media)
( ) Consegue te arrancar uma lágrima ou duas(boa)
( ) Dava pra fazer um bom livro
( ) ainda to chorando...

-- VALE A PENA COMPRAR?

( ) Não
( ) Jogo muito M3rd@, mas é engraçado com amigos
( ) Talvez, mas só na promoção mesmo
( ) Espere até ficar na promoção
(X) Pode comprar que é GG vale cada centavo

-- AUDÍO & MÚSICAS

As músicas são boas, são parecidas com a música do famigerado Minecraft, são bem lentas e calmas, mas achei isso legal, não quero resolver puzzle com um rock metaleiro.(Eu escutava podcast junto)

-- TEXTURAS & GRÁFICOS (isso não define NADA)

Muito bonito pela proposta do jogo!

OBS e CRÍTICA:

Q-beh é o jogo de Puzzle 3D, ele me chamou atenção pelo seu gráfico, usando cubos para resolver os quebra-cabeças durante as fases. o jogo tem em média 9 horas de gameplay mas o seu 100% com as conquistas e tals umas 15 horas (dependendo do seu raciocínio).

Basicamente o jogo é um escape room, ele possui 4 tipos de blocos ou quadrados (como quiser chamar) para te auxiliar/ajudar durante o jogo, o bloco vermelho (Ele é apenas um bloco de apoio) o bloco azul (Ele serve para ativar portas e outras coisas durante o jogo) o roxo (Ele é um bloco especial anti-gravidade, meu favorito inclusive) e por ultimo o verde (Ele funciona como um elevador, defina uma direção e ele vai e se evapora dps) ele também possui check points que são parecido com..é..na real não sei bem o que eram, mas que ajudam MUITO o jogador. (obg por existir)

O gráfico e a textura é bem bonito joguei no very high e falando nisso o jogo é bem leve rodando em qualquer pc e isso é sempre um ponto positivo.

A música é boa, bem imersiva e deixa você no clima do jogo, que é um clima calmo...quase sempre kkk

Enfim gostei bastante, talvez a unica coisa que não gostei foi o sistema de criação de fases que cara, ele não é nada intuitivo e bem difícil e chato de se fazer e mexer, não consegui jogar online mas isso não me afetou muito pois comprei só pela campanha original mesmo, mas se você for comprar só por isso acho que não vale a pena.
Tirando isso o jogo é muito bom, parabéns ao desenvolvedores.

NOTA FINAL: 8.9 / 10
 
Rikpig
212 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 11 juin 2014
An absolutely fantastic and calming puzzle game. They claim it's similar to portal, albeit without the portal gun, and I can certainly say this is a game that lives up to that.

Vidéo YouTube™: QBEH-1: The Atlas Cube - Mac Gameplay 
Vues : 484
NEW QBEH-1: The Atlas Cube, a very unique and relaxing puzzle game, where you traverse new worlds with just the help of coloured cubes.


The puzzles start very easy, giving you only a select few cubes, and then quickly gets you to use them in a variety of ways.

With absolutely lovely music, the game encompasses you in a serene and calming atmosphere that seems to be there to stimulate creative, and problems solving thinking. I would easily recommend this to any puzzle lover.

This game is a treasure. Call it puzzle, call it explore.. it makes you feel like being placed in a mysterious yet beautiful and intriguing world. It is so simple but facinating. The soundtrack is soothing, calming, sometimes strange.. it creates the mood of the world you find yourself in. Check it out for free! http://launchablesocks.bandcamp.com/album/you-and-the-view

I had no technical issues, neither can I complain about the game being unfair or too hard. It just right for some relaxing late night gaming hours.

Gameplay: 10/10
Graphics: 8/10
Sound: 10/10

30th of June: 51 positive reviews and 1 negative. Your call.

5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2014
Qbeh-1 I have to say is wonderful. I am having such a relaxing time playing and exploring. Playing in the sky makes my tummy turn when I am jumping around. I feel like I am really there. The graphics are so pretty. The music is fitting. The sounds are well suited. The colours are perfect! I can't pick any fault in this game. 10/10 If only I didn't have to go to sleep now I would still be playing. When I went to quite the game asks, "Do you want to quite Qbeh-1?" , " Yes or No" I was like "NO! No and I want to play more."
I think my box packing, as I am shifting house, will be a little rushed tomorrow because I am playing this when I wake up. On the other hand I may not sleep in so I can play this some more.
BRAVO for a fantastic game.
 
Ketobbey
1,470 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2016
You know that joke about strategy games upping the difficulty level by giving ridiculous odds against the player and having AI spearmen defeat player tanks, because creating actually smart AI is too much work?
Well, that's basically the Qbeh-1 approach to puzzle gaming.

What little I saw of the game consisted on quite pretty visuals, mild puzzles with rather neat idea brought low by disastrous gameplay: already at the beginning levels started to rely on making several jumps on narrow ledges and far too many of these were such that if you missed, you die and the whole level starts from the beginning. Again and again and again.

It's like when they decided to rip off Portal, they decided it would be a great idea to rip off the worst aspects of Portal. Well, it wasn't a great idea.

And yes, the sad thing is that there was actually some promise showing here.

Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2017
端的に言えばブロックを回収設置してゴールゲートを目指すステージクリア型アクションパズルゲーム
各ステージにはコレクトアイテムが1つあり、ゲートを目指すだけなら通らないような隠されたルートを見つけ出して回収するやりこみ要素もある

最初の一時間での評価は楽しいの一言だったが、ステージが進むに連れてダルいの一言に切り替わる
ステージは空中に浮かんでおり、途中で落下してしまうとチェックポイントから再スタートという苦行が待っている
理詰めで既に解いた場所をその先で失敗をすると舞い戻って何度もやり直しをさせられ、これがかなりダルいのだ

個人的にはあまりオススメできそうにないというのが結論

zeljko.vrba
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 février 2015
I'm not sure why all these Millennials are comparing this to Portal - they are nothing alike. About all they have in common is that they are both in first person and involve puzzle solving. Portal is was not the first puzzle game! This actually reminds me more of Sentinel returns, but only slightly.

Anyway, that aside, this game isn't bad if you are looking for some casual fun. You can't die, there are no enemies and the puzzles aren't too taxing to finish, at least where I have got to. All puzzles in this game are solved by collecting and placing different blocks in certain pre-defined places on a floating map. You can relax and play the game at your own pace. I don't agree that it's as atmospheric as everyone is saying it is, though. I'm not sure where these "nice graphics" everyone keeps mentioning are, either.

Personally, I got very bored very quickly but I also got the game cheap. It's not bad but I don't think it's anything amazing either.

O game chega a ser interessante e os puzzles são bem legais. Mas o que matou o game para mim, Foi o fato de cada fase tem poucos checkpoints, associado a controles ruins e uma grande facilidade de morrer. O resultado é você se verá tendo que refazer várias e várias vezes puzzles que você já havia resolvido. Algo tedioso. E graficamente é bem simples. Sugiro apenas baixar e testar a demo do game.

Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2015
Das Puzzlespiel mit Minecraft-Feeling, Blöcke ohne Ende. Simple Spielmechanik, ein angenehm sanft ansteigender Schwierigkeitsgrad, kein zusätzlicher Ballast (Story, Cutscenes und sowas), aber auch keine manuelle dauerhafte Speichermöglichkeit innerhalb eines Puzzle. Also lös' es oder lass' es. Das ist aber auch das Einzige was ich zu bemängeln habe.
Allerdings ist das Spiel absolut ungeeignet für Leute mit Höhenangst, da die Konstruktionen immer irgendwo im Himmel hängen.

Évaluation publiée le 24 avril 2015
As fun and addictive as Portal.

Vidéo YouTube™: ➜ A Quick Look @ 'Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube' 
Vues : 36
http://store.steampowered.com/app/252550 I take a quick look @ 'Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube' - QBEH-1: The Atlas Cube is an atmospheric 1st-person puzzle platformer by Liquid Flower that takes players on...


The Atlas Cube' - QBEH-1: The Atlas Cube is an atmospheric 1st-person puzzle platformer by Liquid Flower that takes players on an inspired quest through a variety of divergent worlds, each filled with new mysteries and secrets to uncover. In each world, players find special cubes that must be collected and used to navigate to the next portal. Some cubes will simply be used as stepping stones to new areas while others are imbued with magical properties such as gravity and propulsion.

Created by Liquid Flower, QBEH-1: The Atlas Cube is a prequel to their much beloved Qbeh, a small student project that found its way online and into the hands of gamers and journalists alike who wanted more after feasting on the appetizer. Now, QBEH-1: The Atlas Cube builds on the core concept and aesthetics introduced in the original and brings even more polish, passion and gameplay into the new game. - Highly Recommended!

0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2015
Beautiful game and concept ruined by excessive use of jump tasks. Not even puzzles, just cheap amateurish, guess where your feet pixels are and pray they come into contact with the ledge pixels when you make your obscenely tiny jumps.

Also apparently your character has no hands and arms or legs, because you can't climb over anything or even step up on to things. It's jumping and walking and that's it. Party like it's 1995. Seriously Daleks jump better than this guy (or whatever.)

Super disappointed because I love the music and sound and other aspects of the level design. If I could cheat and make the floor marble instead of death-sky it would probably be an awesome game. Honestly I think the floor being lava would be better. At least that would explain why you don't grab ledges with your hands. (No point if you just jumped hip deep into lava.)

If I could play the game with the mirror's edge girl that would probably rock also :)
 
@Innomen

这游戏好玩吗
如玩

喜欢的应该会喜欢吧（废话文学）...we need chinese, cloud save.

202211下，t a o宝，支付宝红包，杉果，本平台，本平台充值折扣掉卡，indie gala，fanatical，humble，daily indie game，loot boy，它处自定义包入的本体约3元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

254 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 mai 2023
The first four levels were pretty enjoyable, after that it seems like the devs decided to make it from a relaxing slow paced puzzle game to an infuriating mistake punishing one. From 5-1 if you miss something you cannot go back anymore. Either doors get permanently closed or you're dropping from somewhere without the ability to ascend again. It always seemed fine because hey it's almost like some kind of a checkpoint. But no, if you did miss something you're stranded there to think if you're actually mentally challenged because you can't solve it and when you realize it's not you, it's the game, you have to restart the level and start from scratch because you clearly missed a cube somewhere or just weren't quick enough to pick it up while travelling.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
11.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2022
Trae workshop, eso ya lo posiciona muy alto, mecánicas simples, solo caminar, saltar, abrir puertas... nada del otro mundo.
Resulta un poco aburrido aveces pero la música acompaña bastante bien.
No tiene una trama, así que cuesta mucho levantar interés en el jugador.
A mi me ha gustado, pero ni tanto, es un poco cliché y repetitivo comparado ♥♥♥ otros juegos del mismo género.
Es un juego bonito, y de pensar un poco, la dificultad no es alta así que resulta corto.
Diseño de niveles agradable, pero no pasa nada interesante.
Si bienes de jugar otros juegos de puzzle no te va a sorprender mucho. 7/10.

d1248
47 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mai 2022
It's a puzzle game and a 3D obstacle course set in an abstract cube world floating in mid-air. The puzzles are about exploring and getting past difficult terrain, which is done by using different types of placeable cubes. These cubes allow for some creative climbing. There are no dangers other than that of falling—or stepping on the wrong cube.

Checkpoints are found in-game at regular intervals. They need to be manually activated, so don’t forget doing that if you’ve just solved a particularly challenging puzzle and don’t want to go through it again. The difficulty builds up slowly, so you will have plenty of time to get used to each type of cube—or get a little bored. There is basically only one type of puzzle, so your enjoyment depends on you liking that one type. Liking cubes also helps. There is some pretty cool stuff, especially later, but it takes some time to get there.

There’s no story. The environments look deserted and some decay has already set in, but they do also hint at some form of conscious or even humanoid presence, with trees, waterfalls, and flowerbeds still being maintained. The place has a low-key beauty, but you are mainly here to solve puzzles—and you’ll get plenty of that, so mission accomplished.

The game glitched out on me once when an effect allowing me to jump higher wasn’t reset when it should have been. This wasn’t a gamestopper in any way, rather the opposite, because it meant I could climb up where I wasn’t supposed to be and feel like such a rebel.

This wasn’t the most challenging puzzle game and I did get a little bored from time to time, but, over all, I had some fun and relaxing times with it. There is also a built-in editor for longevity, which is always a great bonus. I haven’t tried any of it yet, but others have, so there are quite a bit of extra content to try if you want more.

Full review:
https://maskinkultur.com/2018/04/22/review-qbeh-1-the-atlas-cube/
 
Maskinkultur
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
27.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2022
Qbeh-1 : The Atlas Cube est un très beau puzzle game. Le principe est simple il faut traverser les niveaux en jouant avec les blocs amovibles et la physique du jeu pour arriver à la porte de sortie. Le jeu est beau et les musiques invitent à la relaxation. La difficulté est progressive est les mécaniques de jeu sont introduites progressivement. On découvre de cet univers qui invite à la relaxation et à la visite avec plaisir. Pour ce qui est de la durée de vie il faudra compter une grosse dizaine d'heures pour boucler l'aventure, un petit peu plus si vous voulez essayer d'obtenir tous les succès et trouver tous les secrets cachés. Au final ce jeu est une excellente surprise.

For as simplistic as the concept is for this game, it definitely has some of the most difficult puzzles I've ever encountered, especially those to reach the extra tokens in each level. Not to mention the atmosphere is soothing, and the mechanics are interesting as heck.

Happy 2024
553 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 décembre 2021
Игра очень похожа на Q.U.B.E. с некоторыми отличиями, но если первой проходить Q.U.B.E. то ощущается, как некое продолжение. В первых уровнях игра, очень расслабляющая. В этой игре нету какой-то нарастающей сложности, просто идут в перемешку как простые, так и очень хардкорные уровни. А собирание дополнительных токенов, делает некоторые уровни, прям до невозможности тяжелыми. Сохранение в игре только по чек-поинтам.
В остальном игра имеет очень приятную графику, атмосферу и звуковое сопровождение. Иногда очень сильно заставляет задуматься, как пройти ту или иную головоломку.

Wolfsblut
696 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
210.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2021
Эту и игру сравнивают и с Portal и с Q.U.B.E. С первого взгляда она похожа на последнюю, а с Portal ее объединяет то, что это тоже головоломка от первого лица. Мое мнение (после того, как я перепрошел оба куба дважды, из Портала вообще не вылезаю, а эту недавно перепрошел третий раз) - она не похожа ни на что. Те нюансы, которые ее отличают от КУБА - это, во-первых, то, как работает каждый из кубов и, второе, совершенно другая атмосфера - по непонятной для меня причине через какое-то время заставляют возвращаться. Поиск пирамид на каждом уровне - это, считайте, отдельная игра. В общем, вместе с Portal и Принципом Таллоса - эта игра входит в тройку моих самых любимых головоломок от первого лица.

Recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2020
小清新风格抽象解密游戏。

核心机制是跑、跳、放方块、开机关，一共三十关，每关约十五分钟。谜题本身并不难，游戏最大的难度反而来自于第一人称跑酷和掉下去就直接踢回上一个检查点的无底深坑。后期跑酷难度直线上升，不过总体难度也在可控范围内——

前提是你不尝试白金。如果你打算全成就，请做好阴间收集品和阴间成就的洗礼。

Game works smoothly. I've encountered just one bug and that may be game-breaking bug depending on your checkpoint which is when you try to replace a block -especially blue and the purple one- it may not replace it for some reason especially when you're in motion. That's all, I liked the game pretty much. If developers improve this game with new mechanics, contents etc. and add a backstory then comes up with sequel that'll be pretty cool (10/10). Because It's been exactly 7 years since this game released (also I finished at the 7th anniversary, wow :O).
 
HieFX ™
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
47.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2021
Absolutely excellent puzzle game. Innovative & so much fun. Only collected a few tokens/pyramids during play through & at the end of level 5, found out that you need to collect them all to proceed to world 6. This is a negative as this was not clear. Might come back to this later, but that will require an almost full replay & lots of acrobatic jumping puzzles to get them all. Also ran into the green cube dissolving fast problem & that became a game stopping issue at one point, but found something that works but wasn't anywhere online. Anyway, an exhilarating platform game that has some superb puzzles, but the issues that detracted from giving this a top score would be the green cube issue & not being able to complete the game.
 
dbryan1994
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
51.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2020
If you ever want to just relax and play something more simple, I highly recommend this game. It may not seem much at first but it doesn't have to be complicated to be enjoyable. The atmosphere, the soundtrack and the simplicity works extremely well together. I found the puzzles to be very interesting at times and not too stressful, I think that's perfect for a game like this. There is also a level editor for those who want more. One small compliant I have is that it can be a little buggy at times but not enough to be annoying to deal with.

Overall, this is a very beautiful game and I really enjoyed my time playing this.

I Normally don't buy or play puzzle games other than Portal and the like but decided to check this one out as it looked interesting. Simple gameplay and mechanics with puzzles that are not confusing offers a more relaxing than frustrating puzzle experience. Has 6 total worlds with 6 levels each and has workshop support with built in and easy to use level creator to make or download levels endlessly. The game uses the environment and platforming as a basis for the puzzles, with the player using blocks, with various properties, to make it through the levels. Overall a fun and simple puzzle game. Definitely recommend even if you are not into puzzle games.
 
SLDK

7/10
Pros:
+ Quite good cubic graphics
+ Good music and sound of water
♥♥♥♥:
- There is no any history of main character and history of that place. Therefore this game become boring without any purpose in that voyage
- There are some bags ( fall through the blocks, block was placed not in that place where you choose, etc. )
Other:
+- Gameplay of the game suficiently interesting for the length of the game, but there are almost no opportunities except using cubes for building something or use them in different purposes. However, minimalism like that is quite common thing for games of this type, therefore neither plus nor minus.

Conclusion: Puzzle game in flying cubical world.

2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2019
Не знаю почему многие решили, будто это похоже на Portal.
Гораздо более близкий аналог - Fabric.

В принципе прямо уж головоломок тут нет. Очень мало моментов, где именно нужно было думать. По большей части нужно искать кубы. Нашёл - что делать уже понятно, прошёл дальше.

Кое-где изредка (а именно при поиске золотых пирамид) всё-таки приходилось извращаться.
Тем не менее, играть довольно увлекательно, плюс не возбраняется проходить уровни по-своему.

Продолжительность - часов 8. И да, работает на Windows XP.

Хоть простовато и однообразно, всё же рекомендую любителям жанра.

Non recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2019
Don’t get me wrong; I liked Qbeh-1 to begin with when I first started playing it, but once I got into the pattern of solving puzzles it simply started to fall apart for me. If I was going to rate this game, I’d have to give it a 4/10 at the lowest and a 6/10 at the highest. I am super indifferent about it.

My problem is simply this: the first level is amazing and beautiful; great soundtrack, great visuals, since you’re new to the puzzles they feel fresh and then you get to the second level where everything ramps up to be a 10/10 game with reasonably challenging puzzles and an even better soundtrack which made me completely relaxed and…. Well, I think I decided to refund the game about the 5th level because the 3rd, 4th and 5th level just began to bore me with said gameplay loop I enjoyed to begin with and the soundtrack and visuals were getting worse for wear. The game didn’t feel as relaxing as well, although I don’t remember fully why. Something about the soundtrack, unless I experienced a glitch which stopped the music entirely so I only got ambient ghostly wind sounds.

This game is relaxing when played in pieces, but when you’re like me and prefer to get through a game within only a day or two that’s when you start having problems.

So yeah; it’s a great game but I’m personally mixed about it as it’s meant for a certain person; a person who progress through a game at a slow pace.

10.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2019
Qbeh-1 is a well done and atmospheric 1st-person puzzle platformer with some fresh ideas and a appropriate musical soundtrack, to spend many hours solving cube-based puzzles.You're looking for an alternative to Portal or Talos Principle, you should have a look at this. With the included Qbeh-1-level-editor you can create your own awesome levels in a jiffy and share it with your friends or the Qbeh-1-community.
The hardware requirements are moderate. I had a lot of fun with the game and its editor and can absolutely recommend it.

Here an example for a level made by myself:
Qbehsis - Aftermath

____________________________

Qbeh-1 ist ein gut gemachter und atmospherischer Puzzle-Platformer aus der Ego-Perspektive mit einigen frischen Ideen und einem passenden Soundtrack, mit dem man viele Stunden mit dem Lösen würfelbasierter Rätsel verbringen kann. Wenn Du auf der Suche nach einer Alternative zu Portal oder Talos Principle bist, solltest Du einen Blick riskieren. Die Hardwareanforderungen sind moderat. Mit dem inkludierten Qbeh-1-Level-Editor kannst Du Deine eigenen fantastischen Level kreieren und sie mit Freunden oder der Qbeh-1-Community teilen.
Ich hatte eine Menge Spaß mit dem Spiel und seinem Editor und kann es uneingeschränkt empfehlen.

Hier ein Beispiel eines von mir erstellten Levels:
Qbehsis - Aftermath

35 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
16.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2019
Hoch oben im Himmel befinden sich Ruinen, die man in der First-Person-Perspektive mit Hilfe unterschiedlicher Würfel durchqueren muss. Letztere lassen sich an spezifischen Orten fixieren, um sie als Tritthilfe zu nutzen und damit Hindernisse oder Abgründe zu überwinden.

Der Himmel um die Ruinen wirkt mythisch und endlos und generiert eine tolle Atmosphäre, unterstützt durch dezente Musik. In jedem Level gibt es für die echten Rätselkönige eine goldene Pyramide als Bonus zu entdecken.

Das Spiel hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Die Rätsel sind stets gut lösbar. Nur selten knobelt man etwas länger, bis man weiterkommt.

Daumen hoch! Das Spiel hat mir sehr gut gefallen und ich kann es allen wärmstens empfehlen, die gerne Rätselspiele in der First-Person-Perspektive zocken!

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
81.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2018
Absolutely beautiful. You picked an A-Grade composer for the relaxing soundtrack that anyone wouldnt mind listening to during a puzzle game. the levels look jaw-dropping while also dangerous to traverse, especially if you're looking for the secrets in every one. There were a few times where I actually was afraid of falling. The puzzles start simple and while they introduce more cubes and items also get a LOT harder as you progress. The cherry on top is definitely the level editor, however. I didn't think a game that looked this good would have the space for an easy-to-use level editor but it did, putting some of the other games in my library to shame. This might be one of my favorites, and Im not even kidding there. The physics can be weird, but that's okay. Sometimes it's even funny. Anyway, beautiful game. I'm definitely recommending.

The Holy Kataruna
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2018
Francamente non comprendo il motivo di tante recensioni positive.
Trattasi di gioco semplice nel concetto (puzzle game ♥♥♥ i cubi) che punta a distinguersi come rilassante e meditativo grazie alla musica delicata e al semplice ambiente onirico, sempre uguale tra un livello e l'altro.
I problemi del gioco sono:
- la sua ripetitività, al 3rzo livello vi sarete probabilmente già stufati di sparare cubi su cubi
- il nervosismo per cadute inaspettate dovute a salti mal calibrati
- la dispersività nei livelli più avanzati, considerando inoltre che gli ambienti sono molto simili tra loro

Se proprio volete provarlo, aspettate l'offerta..si trova anche a meno di 1 euro.
E se vi interessa il genere, come al sottoscritto..provate TRI, quello si è che è rilassante, divertente ed immersivo.

-------------------------------------------------

IMHO I can't understand why so many positive reviews.
It's just a simple game from a simple concept (puzzle game with cubes) that aims to stand out as relaxing and meditative thanks to the delicate music and the simple dreamlike environment, always the same between one level and another.

The problems of the game are:
- its repetitiveness, on the 3rd level you will probably already be tired of throwing cubes on cubes
- nervousness due to unexpected falls due to poorly calibrated jumps
- the dispersivity in the most advanced levels, considering also that the environments are very similar to each other

If you really want to try it, wait for the offer .. you could find it for less than 1 euro.
And if you are interested in the genre, like me, try TRI, that is really relaxing, fun and immersive.
 
CyberWYX

Lant
469 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
14.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juin 2018
So I really have mixed feelings about this game. The main game is good and can have some great puzzles and interesting game mechanics. It's biggest downfall is not knowing where you need to go in some of the bigger levels. It wasn't enough to make me put down the game, but it might with others.

My biggest gripe though is the level editor. If you enjoy being creative in making your own levels, this isn't the game. There are multiple bugs still in it like the level not saving correctly and no special lighting or shadows when playing the level. Even after years of this game being out, they're still not fixed and it's highly unlikely the developers will. It's such a shame. I was really looking forward to creating levels with cool lighting effects like in the main game, but it sadly isn't possible.

To sum up: Good main game, Bad level editor.
 
musicmaster88
907 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
24.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mai 2018
Un petit jeu de type First Person Puzzle, dans la lignée de Portal ou QUBE. Une sorte de Minecraft d'enigmes.

Très accessible est plaisant à jouer, il n'est pas néanmoins exempt de difficultés sur la fin. Centré sur la réflexion, plutôt que la plateforme, il faut néanmoins beaucoup explorer et observer l'environnement.

Le jeu est adapté à un jeune public, car sans violence, ou élément angoissant.

Si vous aimez la reflexion, et que la vue première personne ne vous gène pas, c'est un bon investissement.
 
3XE

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
14.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 février 2018
图文攻略：https://tieba.baidu.com/f?kz=3601199083&mo_device=1&ssid=0&from=1000953f&uid=0&pu=usm@0,sz@1320_2001,ta@iphone_1_5.0_3_534&bd_page_type=1&baiduid=8636EF84B876F22E654B4EA27B6BEEDB&tj=www_normal_1_0_10_title&referer=m.baidu.com?pn=0&
视频攻略在指南里，但是只能在某不存在的视频网站看。
——————短暂的分界线——————
立方秦天之盒
没有官中的报复性乱翻
虽然没有中文但问题不大，实际流程里无需文字。
+流程长到surprising，any通关9小时（30小关），全收集15小时（36小关），这游戏估计any％speedrun也要100分钟
成就党记得看攻略以确保前30关全收集，这样才能玩最后六个小关，最后跑回头路不累死你
+作为一款休闲游戏，动作解密方面基本不为难玩家，快速运动的桥段很少，解密不用看攻略
+有卡，bgm丰富，场景风格丰富，后期不少关卡通关手段多样
+ 和MC只有半毛钱的关系你玩了之后就会发现这游戏除了同样使用“方块”这一概念外其他地方完全看不到MC的痕迹
+创意工坊的存在增强了可玩性，隔壁几个游戏都没有这个东西。不过工坊作品质量参差不齐其实都挺感人的，唯一有点意思的就是几张跳跃图了（然而这游戏并不能kz）
-存档点设计不合理，部分存档点之间间距过近，部分又过远，死一次重复大量操作时常发生，曾为此怒删游戏然后下回来
-有点时候感觉自己只不过是去找路找方块而不是解密
-存档点*2：不好意思为什么存档的图腾哥是无法互动的啊?部分关卡无法原路返回，走到下一个存档点发觉未收集足够的方块，因此只能从关头开始的情况时而发生，希望制作人能将存档点设计为可互动的，这样方便回到上上个存档点以弥补之前的失误操作。
总的来说是很有自己风格的一款休闲游戏，推荐打折购买
－7.7/10
 
Gypsophila
485 produits enregistrés
0

EchoPalias
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2017
UNA EXPERIENCIA RELAJANTE SIN SACRIFICAR JUGABILIDAD

Qbeh-1 ofrece 3 incentivos para que lo juegues: tiene puzles, tiene exploración y es relajante.

Los puzles son sencillos en su mayoría y, aunque suelen tener una única solución a nivel de concepto, suele darse libertad en cómo colocar los bloques para materializar ese concepto. Los nuevos tipos de bloques que se añaden a lo largo del juego ayudan a que nunca te llegues a aburrir de manejar siempre las mismas posibilidades y te tengas que moldear a nuevas reglas.

La exploración es totalmente opcional, por fase hay un "token" escondido que no suele ser fácil de encontrar, y suele pedir o bien que estemos atentos al escenario o bien que llevemos un paso más allá las mecánicas para acceder a zonas fuera del camino ♥♥♥ los bloques disponibles. Los escenarios son muy atractivos visualmente, por lo que se agradece que haya un incentivo para pararse a mirarlos y comprender su estructura, además de ofrecer una capa de profundidad extra para los que busquen un desafío un poco mayor, como es mi caso.

Por último y como he destacado en el título, Qbeh-1 es un juego relajante, y todos sus elementos refuerzan esta sensación. Los escenarios son simples pero muy bonitos y la banda sonora es excelente (♥♥♥ un tema propio para cada fase). La única pega que le puedo sacar al juego y que tiene que ver ♥♥♥ esto es que el personaje se mueve un poco lento, pero es algo que, aunque requiere unas pocas fases para acostumbrarse, acaba aportando mucho al juego, ya que ayuda a que nos tomemos las cosas ♥♥♥ calma y disfrutemos más de la experiencia.

En resumen, Qbeh-1 es un juego que recomiendo a cualquiera y es perfecto para meterse a hacer una fase cuando no hay mucho tiempo de juego. Acabo de terminar la historia y ya estoy deseando atacar el mundo extra y los niveles de la comunidad (que tienen muy buena pinta).
 
jorloru
1,237 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
48.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2017
Here's a proof simplicity & care can lead to a good game. The effort put on minimalistic music/ambiance, nice shadow & lighting work, the 2 level of difficulty design (ending a level being first, finding an optionnal token at same being second), the various 6x6 maps proposed, that makes already a decent overall. But if you add to that a map creation mode and its about 200 community freely subscribable maps (through Workshop section of its Steam Hub), Qbeh-1 is clearly over the average of its genre. Indeed, it would need to be slightly less sober to become a major title, but nobody would deny it's an enjoyable world to spend time in.

28.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
Oui, c'est un jeu relaxant, on aime se perdre et explorer les petits mondes savamment crées.
Toute la richesse repose aussi sur la recherche du triangle jaune, qui est toujours caché de manière intéressante et jamais frustrante.
Compter 12/15h pour le faire à 100% en prenant votre temps... c'est un jeu fait pour ça, se faire plaisir tout au long du voyage.
Si vous êtes du genre à torcher les jeux en mode speed run, ce n'est clairement pas fait pour vous.

A moins de 1.5e en promo il n'y a pas de raison de ne pas se l'offrir.

frankzafka
1,052 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
167.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2016
Qbeh-1 perfectly achieves what it sets out to do: Being an atmospheric puzzle game. Nothing more, nothing less.
The ambience the game sets is incredible. A soothing soundtrack, mysterious ruins and mellow light effects all do their part to pull the player into the level. The puzzles in Qbeh-1 are easy enough to keep the immersion of the overall setting, but also challenging enough to not be boring. Hidden secrets and the occasional easter egg reward exploring.
Qbeh-1 offers 36 levels and supports Community Created levels for additional fun.

If you enjoy exploration, a relaxing and sometimes breathtaking ambience or decently crafted puzzles Qbeh-1 is definitely worth buying.
 
DSpecht
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2016
Absolutely amazing game, I cannot recommend it enough (ignore my hours played, they're mostly offline in the last few days). The various worlds atmospheres sre sublime, just a couple hours playing it leaves me so feeling so peaceful it's like I've been on holiday for a week. The mechanics are simple but very polished. My only issue is that an xbox controller doesn't work in the menu and on world/level select screens but the fact the controls are so well done that I can even use it on what I'd usually call a m/k game says a lot.

I've played hundreds of games on steam alone and this is the first time I've made the effort to write a review. This one of those games that should've done a lot better and I'm only sorry I left it unplayed in my library for so long.

Clyde the Hobo
277 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2016
This is a very good action puzzle game, and easily worth the price with or without a sale.

What really surprised me was the amount of "skill layers" the game has. First you will be finishing levels, finding that quite hard enough. By the end of the 5 worlds, you'll be ready to go back and start spotting secrets, sort of a "level 2" of the whole game. It's all quite a nice learning curve and builds up on previous game skills and your newfound knowledge of using the game elements together.

The base game with the first credits ending can be obtained within 6-8 hours. But if you are the curious sort and are running without looking at the guides, the secrets and hidden stuff can easily bring that total to 20 hours as you unlock more hidden stuff. I don't want to spoil it in this review, but the game has a little bit more to it then first appears.

It's gameplay focuses most on physical placement puzzles, but you will need to practice some platforming to complete it. Especally at the end, there are a few points where you will need to be quick at placing or grabbing blocks. Nothing too insane, most of the "action sequences" are either straightforward or you will be given a chance to oversee the area before diving into it. The speed parts are more a test of your ability to stay calm and stick to a previously thought up plan under pressure then anything else. Checkpoints are quite plenty as well, and instantly reload if you fall or die.

The levels are brillantly laid out. You often will find what you need with a little bit of exploring. In the process of finding those bricks you also will have a good visual of each new puzzle you come across before needing to solve it. There are also lots of hidden and not so hidden places that are simply eye candy or "breathing space", so you really do feel like you are exploring instead of walking from puzzle to puzzle. A few have some great views or other neat little rewards for being curious. Some (but not all) of the puzzles also have many solutions, leaving it up to you to "free solve" it several different ways. I loved the "smart" feeling I got for coming up with solutions that didn't use all the blocks or let me walk out with extra ones for the next area.

The music is also very good, and passes in and out throughout the levels to aid in creating some pretty neat moods and situations. It's very cool how each level has almost the same level elements but each also has a very unique feel or mood to match the puzzle themes. It will keep you pumped for the big puzzles, and stay quiet when you need silence to focus or transition your mind between puzzles.

On the negative, some levels loading times were a bit long on my low end computer. The checkpoints respawning is very fast, which is very welcome when you fall off and it auto reloads nearly instantly. The game only needs to load the level when you first enter it or transition to a new one from a level exit. So it's nothing game breaking.

One other thing to note is that while the levels have lots of checkpoints to them, each level can take anywhere from 15 to 45 minuites the first time you explore it. If you quit the game you will lose your checkpoint and have to start at the very beginning of the level again. It's not terrible as once you know the solutions each puzzle can be "redone" in under a minute tops. But it's worth noting this isn't a quick pop in and out type of game.

I highly recommend this one if you like physical/positional puzzles. It's a great experience that manages to be so much more then it's parts, thanks to very clever level design and careful use of music and level name tags. It doesn't try to overreach or do something it can't do, like having a dialog story or being a hardcore difficulty suddenly. Every time it reaches the point of feeling impossible the level design steps back a notch and shifts gears, keeping it fresh till the end.

I had gone in expecting a small little game about placing blocks that would last 6-8 hours tops and probably rip off minecraft. Having played Qbeh, I can say I certainly recieved much more then that. This experience is going to stick with me as a personal favorite for quite some time.
 
DarkGriffin
635 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 octobre 2016
Definitely DO NOT PLAY if you have a fear of heights and/or falling. I don't think I really do, but every time I had to jump over open air my heart climbed up into my mouth. It's a fantastic game even though I'm not great at platformers, and it's pretty intuitive to play, but every level is suspended up in the stratosphere over vast quantities of sky and nothing.

一开始以为游戏就是像试玩的部分一样简单，就当个休闲游戏玩玩好了，没想到这游戏还真没那么简单，除了解谜部分以外，也有点考验跳跃技巧。

现在看着就发愁，很想一下子通关删了，又一想还是想把每关收集要素都找到就一拖再拖。。

原价就很值

Webby
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
44.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2016
A fun, challenging little puzzle game. If the developers decide to make a Qbeh-2, I strongly suggest giving it a story. What makes games like The Talos Principle and Portal 2 so fantastic is the combination of challenging puzzles and a slowly-unfolding story. Qbeh, while fun for what it is, felt a little tedious at times. Each puzzle took on a same-ness, because there was no story to drive it forward, no sense that behind the next door would be some revelation. Instead, behind the next door is another door is another door. The atmosphere is beautiful (reminiscent of The Labyrinth), and it's pleasant enough, for what it is.
 
wander
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2016
This game has great atmosphere. You feel like you're up in the sky in this strange setting. I'm not sure what other people expect going into it, but it's not a puzzle game per se. Yes there are puzzle type elements there, but for me at least it's a lot more about the feeling I get when I play this game. It's not like any other game I've played. Anytime I just want to wind down at the end of the day and play something relaxing I'll open it up and I'm transported to a quiet place, with enough intrigue to keep me going.

It's not for everyone, obviously, and if you go into it expecting difficult puzzles, you'll be disappointed. Yes, it's repetitive, but there are other things that really make me like it that I can't explain. It's on sale right now for 1.49, so I mean for that price you can hardly go wrong I guess just to try it out.

Recommandé
13.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2016
非常棒的游戏，类似于传送门的动作解谜。
13小时全通，游戏难度适中，有的地方还是要想一会儿的
游戏机制非常的棒，简单而有趣
原声音乐好评，不过要是你一直卡在某一关听着就会很烦躁
故事性不足，不过独立游戏要求也不能太高
总而言之，非常值得一玩，而且有了创意工房了
成就比较难，一周目除了通关成就一个成就都没出，略尴尬。。。。
对了，这游戏没有对话和提示，所以完全不需要支持中文就能玩

Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2016
I\'m a huge fan of games like Portal, QUBE, Talos Principle etc.
But I just hate this game.

I havent even played very far, but already I\'m bored with the game.
-You walk too slow
-Far between checkpoints, forcing you to repeat parts over and over
-The mechanic for solving the puzzles feels broken


This game is 5% puzzle solving, and 95% frustration.
I have no idea how this can be so highly rated.

Don\'t buy if you\'re looking for a good puzzle game.

49.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mai 2016
Поначалу игра взбесила минимализмом во всём. Интерес хоть как-то поддерживал поиск солнечных призм. И вот когда я дошел до второго Мира игра сразу преобразилась. На каждом уровне играла своя интересная музыка. В каждом Мире как оказалось своя обстановка. Появились ночные уровни и утренние/вечерние. Геймплей тоже стал другим благодаря появлению фиолетового и зеленого куба. Еще есть в игре секретный 6 Мир, на который можно попасть если собрал все призмы в предыдущих Мирах.
Оценка 72/100

582 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 avril 2016
I am approaching the 2 hour (gameplay) mark in this game and am loving it now that I know how to play. The levels are great both in design and difficulty. The level designs make the secenery something players should take a second to admire and differing enough per level and "world" so as to not get repetative. The level difficulty is at a point so that they are not something that you will breeze through (except for speedrunners...yes there are speedrunners in this game) because they will require thought. Add on to that the fact that there is the story levels and player designed levels. I recommend this game.
 
LilDagnamet
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
212.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2016
This game is relaxing to play, the puzzles start off easy and get harder and I have not found all the secrets yet and look foward to doing that, for the main game it is worth it alone.

The level editor takes time to get used to and can seem quite complicated to start with, stick with it because it is fun to build in. many colours of wall and floor, Ice and dirt and hazard blocks make big variety in design. Light cubes and source can be any colour you like with the RGB mixer intensity and range.

I have created 8 levels I guess now and still like making more. if you dare you can do curved levels. also the music in the main game can be used and sky boxes are plenty so every level can have a different feel.

22.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2016
This little game made by only a few people is a brilliant example of how a simple idea, simply visualized, can still be a great game. A few times i even found myself in this block-based worlds just standing on a balcony and enjoying the scenery.

+ The developers were (can't say if they're still doing it) supporting the community in the forums.
+ level editor is fun
+ you can often find your own ways

- that damn penguin... always trolling me (just kidding, that's just my own opinion^^)

All in all a 9,5/10 if you like puzzle games. Must buy on sale.
Thank you, devs.

11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2015
E' un mix tra platform e puzzle game ♥♥♥ una predominanza verso il platform. Grafica minimalista, ma gradevole, poca varietà negli ambienti. I difetti principali sono due: i checkpoint intermedi di un livello non vengono mantenuti quando si esce dal gioco e si è costretti a reiniziare lo stesso livello; inoltre c'è una certa imprecisione nel comando del salto che fa cadere spesso nel vuoto.
A me è piaciuta l'atmosfera misteriosa e i livelli ben progettati. Chi vuole può cimentarsi nel raccogliere anche le piramidi segrete aumentando notevolmente il livello di sfida.

 
Kaspar Hauser
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2015
For me, this game is an interesting mix of Voxel blocks with puzzle elements and different mechanics designed into 6 tranquil, serene but playful environments that make for a relaxing yet still challenging Puzzle Platformer that made me think.

The variety of mechanics and gameplay excels, and while there are some barely noticeable mistakes, all of the levels are well designed and approach diverges often. I had great fun in one world where one level was about solving different sections by connecting rooms together and using floating platforms, the next was the simple fun of jumping from level to level around the outside of a tower and the next involved conserving cubes and placing them in just the right order.

Highlights

Things that stand out about Qbeh-1 include the stellar serenity of the levels. The lighting in particular is well designed, and has clearly had more time spent on it than most games. The backdrops to worlds are beautiful and little floating trees, fountains and foliage mesh with the clouds and light to make it nice just to look around. When combined with a calm and mildly uplifting soundtrack, the worlds become very relaxing and sombre from the outside.

As already stated, the other important stand out factor of Qbeh-1 is the varying approach to levels, and most worlds introduce a new mechanic or two, a new cube or a new approach to gameplay. It keeps you thinking in different ways and makes it a better experience overall.

* The secret items are placed pretty well and most require you to think outside the box. They're a fun optional extra.

Mistakes & Annoyances

There are some small annoyances on this title, but absolutely nothing that takes away from the gameplay or stands out. Things I came across are listed here purely for the sake of complete review.

* Placing cubes around edges is slow, fiddly and frustrating. Due to the nature of gameplay a "hold" button (like in Minecraft) wouldn't have worked, but some effort towards making placement around edges easier would've been simple and made these far less fidgety.
* The title screen is somewhat lacking and mediocre. The World Selection menu in particular is simply frustrating and forces you to spin overly responsive cubes to find the world you want each time.
* The game will actively remove your cubes if it doesn't correspond to the amount it thinks you should have for a section if you die or reload a checkpoint, which is very annoying.

Recommendations

Qbeh-1 is priced at £6.99/8.99€/$9.99 at the time of review, and with 6 slow-paced levels on each of 6 worlds for a total of 36 realms, play time clocks in at a minimum of 7 hours, and completionists and collectors can expect more trying to find all the Pyramids. Overall Qbeh is fairly priced and has reached as low as -90% in sales, which is an absolute steal for what is quite clearly an underrated puzzle game.

* The blissful soundtrack is by Launching Socks and you can listen to a number of their tracks free on their Soundcloud[soundcloud.com]
*Qbeh-1 is actually the pre-sequel to the original title Qbeh, which is still available to play for free on Desura[www.desura.com] and offers 30 minutes+ of very similar gameplay
* An impressive set of Minecraft maps with a similar theme is being created, called Qbeh-1 A Crafters Cube[www.minecraftforum.net]
 
dux

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
16.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2015
Так-с, игра представляет собой 3D платформер с головоломками, и, в общем, она так себе (по моему объективному мнению =) ) и я готов объяснить почему:
+ не напряжные головоломки
+ тайник на каждом уровне за сбор которых даётся весьма крутая награда
+ окружение приятное глазу (на первую пору)
+ удобное управление
+ есть даже пару тайных комнат с секретиками, но они скучны (за исключением одной)

- нет серьёзных головоломок вообще
- очень мало динамики в игре
- нет сюжета вообще
- очень однообразный гемплей
- очень однообразный, минималистично-ущербный дизайн мира (даже для инди - перебор)

+- музыка нейтральна

Итого: это игра для вас, если вам не нужен разнообразный дизайн в игре, если вам не обязательно нужен сюжет и динамика, вы не хотите напрягать мозги. А вам хочется просто бегать и прыгать (постоянно) по кубикам, решая простые головоломки, и, быть может, искать тайники.

Добавлю 2 совета:
1) Если иснать тайники ради получения награды, то придётся делать это на каждом уровне, а это утомляет (мне так пришлось перепройти не одну карту)
2) Если вы хотите эту игру, т.к. она вам кажется похожей на портал, то лучше вам взглянуть на Antichamber, по мне так эта игра превосходит Q-beh по всем параметрам и, местами, даже выигрывает портал.

P.S. всем добра, даже тем, кому не понравился мой обзор =)
P.P.S. ах да, ставлю Q-beh 4 из 10 золотых пирамидок
 
AlmaCarter

Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2015
Voxel, parkour, puzzle game. Probably the only linear game you wood like, with the nice soft textures, beautiful skylines, and rhythmic ambient music, you can stare at or listen to for hours. The music will change, depending on the ambience of the setting. With the gameplay going between easy, medium, hard and back, throughout the adventure.

I loved this game. Wish it didn't end. Worth $5 - $20 depending on your taste. 5 Stars for me. 3 or 4 for others.

First person puzzler that reminds me of Portal. Use different types of blocks in innovative ways to create a path to the end of each puzzle. Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juin 2015
Qbeh-1 The Atlas Cube é um jogo incrível, apesar de não apresentar nenhuma história aparente (joguei por 25 minutos, mais ou menos, tive que estudar depois kk). O jogo segue linear como todo puzzle, não apresenta escolhas que irão influenciar na sua jornada, mas mesmo assim o jogo é bom. A movimentação é lisa e precisa, às vezes dá umas bugadas, mas faz parte. O que torna Qbeh-1 The Atlas Cube incrível é a ambientação e o desafio. Os lugares em que o jogo se passa, todo esse ar psicodélico, é maravilhoso, a parte gráfica realmente é incrível. Dá vontade de ficar ali, parado, apenas relaxando e apreciando toda a beleza de um jogo na qual a ambientação é fantástica. A respeito do desafio o jogo é bem fácil: pegue esse cubo, coloque ali, abra portas, siga para o próximo nível. Qbeh-1 The Atlas Cube é um jogo que recomendo muito para você que tem uma vida estressante. Compre, jogue e aprecie.
 
samuca maravilha

Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2015
At first you may think this is some sort of Minecraft rip-off, but it's not. Your job is to find your way through the levels using the cubes you are given. The puzzles may get a little bit repetitive after some time, but still fun enough.
What I really liked about this game was the immersion level. It is a really simple game, however really beautiful. The lightning and soundtrack are great. I almost felt cold on snowy or windy levels.

Évaluation publiée le 15 juin 2015
Отличная игрушка! Люблю головоломки такого типа. Сначала кажется - почему никто не объясняет назначение разного типа кубиков? А потом понимаешь, что разобраться самому гораздо интереснее!
Жёлтые маркеры не всегда удаётся найти, но youtube всегда готов прийти на помощь!

Нашёл один баг, скорее даже чит-баг: если подойти к чек-пойнту, находясь в поле действия пониженной гравитации (фиолетовый кубик), то при вызове сохранения этого чек-пойнта можно забрать кубик обратно, при этом пониженная гравитация будет действовать везде! Пример - World 3 Level 2. Довольно забавно можно попрыгать по уровню. Нормальная гравитация возвращается в следующем уровне, или если поставить и убрать фиолетовый кубик.
 
MrNumbers
264 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
24.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2015
This game is a puzzle game where you have to strategically place different blocks (that do different things) in order to move forward, progress in the game and go to the next level. Thus far, there is no story to the game, just the puzzles. I am currently on World 2, Level 1 with a little over four hours of game play. I may edit my review once I have completed the game but wanted to get a review of encouragement out there for those of you who may be contemplating buying it.

To give you a benchmark, there are a couple of similar games that come to mind: Portal (which I did not like) and Talos Principle (that I loved, though it had a rather complex story line to go with it).

I wasn't sure I was going to like it because a number of the (mostly negative) reviews talked about the platforming aspect. I like some platforming games but admit I've quit a couple because I got too frustrated with constantly falling and/or dying. Not so with this game. For me, it's been easier using the mouse and keyboard than the game controller. The best way to do the jumps, in my experience, is not to "look down" at the jump, but rather straight ahead.

Very challenging puzzles, but not insurmountable. I am enjoying the challenge.
 
dsegel4

De resto, não tenho o que reclamar. Super recomendo.

Évaluation publiée le 2 juin 2015
This game is like the love child of either one of the Portal games and any 3-D platformer, and it is fantastic! The soundtrack for the game is amazing and each level has its own song that makes it unique. Keep in mind that this game is not meant for those who want something to completely penetrate their mind and make their heads bleed from various places. The puzzles in this game are very casual and are meant to be played a little at a time, take it slow and enjoy each level for its music and its individual challenge.

This game deserves a solid 10/10 because it is truly great!

Recommandé
37.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2015
I couldn't recommend this game any harder. It's got everything: Puzzle solving. And nothing else. And I think that's fantastic - I really do.
It's first person puzzle solving involving cubes you pick up that do various things. And you just navigate around the environment, trying to find your way through the level. Also there are pyramids to collect in each level if you want.

It's seriously good. It's clever without being too hard. If you're stuck, wander around until you're not. I only had to look up a single thing, and it turned out to be blazingly obvious, really.

Buy it. If you like puzzles, seriously get this game. It's one of my all time favorites.

Andrew
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mars 2015
Avis : Testé sous Oculus Rift DK2.

Après un bordel sans nom pour réussir à comprendre comment le faire marcher sur oculus, ce fut une claque visuelle.
Ce jeu est non seulement très ésthetique mais aussi l'un des plus immersif que j'ai eu l'occasion d'essayer avec mon DK2.
Les fondus de lumières, les sons bien choisis, et les ambiances passant de l'angoissant au féérique au fil des niveaux font que cette expérience vaudrait son prix, même sans les puzzles à côté juste pour la beauté de la chose.

(En revanche au bout d'une heure et demis j'ai du arrêter à cause de maux d'estomacs soudains, alors que d'autres jeux me permettent de jouer sur oculus plusieurs heures d'affilé sans soucis.)

Malgré ma faible configuration (Netbook) il tourne très bien et en bonne qualité.

Au niveau du gameplay c'est un puzzle game sans vraiment de difficulté (du moins après 1h30 de jeu). Il tient aussi des phases de jump, mais surtout de l'exploration.

Bref je le recommande à tous ceux qui ont un oculus et qui aimeraient un jeu posé, plein de couleurs, pour se laisser aller et profiter de la réalité virtuelle dans d'excellentes conditions.

Pour ceux qui cherchent comme moi comment le passer sous Oculus rift :

To get the Oculus Rift supported version, follow these steps:
1) In Library, right click Qbeh-1
2) Select Properties
3) Click Betas tab
4) From the dropdown menu select rift_beta
5) Steam should start updating the game (if not, restart Steam)
6) In Steam open Qbeh-1 Properties set launch option: -vr
 
Arthuria
